html:
Get your iPhone to alert you if you're at risk of falling

How to get your iPhone to alert you if you’re at risk of falling.

As we age, we lose our sense of balance and become more prone to falling. It will happen to all of us eventually, but in old age, a fall can be really debilitating.

That’s why the Walking Steadiness app is so great. It tracks the way you walk – including speed and step length – and then rates your risk of falling over the next 12 months.
subtitle: Falling alert

html:
Get your iPhone to alert you if you're at risk of falling

It gives you the following ratings for your walking steadiness:

OK – you’re at little risk of falling in the next 12 months.

Low – your walking steadiness has declined and there is an increased risk of you falling in the next 12 months.

And Very Low – your walking steadiness has declined significantly and there is a high risk of falling in the next 12 months.

Your iPhone will send you a notification to indicate if your steadiness level has changed while the Health app will also suggest different activities to improve your steadiness in the future.
subtitle: Falling alert

html:
Get your iPhone to alert you if you're at risk of falling

How do you use it? Open the Health App and within the browse screen tap on Mobility, before tapping on Walking Steadiness Notifications.
subtitle: Falling alert

html:
Get your iPhone to alert you if you're at risk of falling

Then follow the onscreen instructions to set it up. You may need to provide some personal data as part of this, including your weight and height.
subtitle: Falling alert
